results.content: Discretionary Personal Leave of Absence Personal leave may be granted for justifiable reasons at Capsule’s discretion. Personal leave will be without pay. However, if the team member has accrued but unused PTO the PTO must be exhausted. During a discretionary personal leave of absence, an eligible team member’s coverage in Capsule’s health plan will end at the end of the month in which their leave begins. Vesting of any equity will also stop during the personal leave. Team members will be eligible to continue equity vesting and enroll in Capsule benefits on the first day they return to work. To apply for a personal leave of absence, please contact both your direct supervisor and the People Team at peopleops@capsule.com at least two (2) weeks in advance of the absence, if possible. If granted, the leave will be for a stated period of time, at which point the team member is expected to return to work.

results.content: DPTO does not supersede Capsule’s policies for illness or injury, disability, parental or family leave, bereavement, jury duty, court appearances, military duty, or other time off or leaves of absence (some of which are mandated by applicable law), such as Capsule’s policies regarding the Family and Medical Leave Act and Military Leave. Capsule permits and expects team members who are qualified to take a leave of absence to do so. DPTO does not apply to leaves of absence and DPTO cannot be used to compensate team members for reasons covered by leaves of absence (including in situations where a team member is not approved for a leave of absence). For the avoidance of doubt, DPTO is not available for use during absences related to a team member’s illness or injury or the illness or injury of a family member, which are covered by separate policies, including the Sick Leave policy. DPTO also may not be used to extend a leave of absence, or a duration of paid sick leave.

results.content: The leave policies below are applicable for full-time team members. Part-time team members are not eligible for leave policies. Part-time team members may reach out to local state agencies to request a paid state leave. Part-time team members who go out on leave must report their approved state agency leave with their manager and peopleops@capsule.com. Capsule’s leave policies are meant to supplement federal and state leave programs. The People Team will help guide you through the leave process. If you are eligible for paid state leaves, you must apply to those agencies directly. Anticipated payments from state and local agencies will be subtracted from Capsule wage continuation so that you may earn up to, but not over, 100% of your base annual rate. Leaves can be taken concurrently so long as application of leaves do not conflict. All teammates should make their best efforts to give 30 days notice to peopleops@capsule.com prior to taking a foreseeable leave.
